title: My Favorite Tuna Salad
summary: My Favorite Tuna Salad is a gluten free, primal, whole 30, and pescatarian recipe with 1 servings. One portion of this dish contains around 35g of protein, 5g of fat, and a total of 221 calories. For $1.66 per serving, this recipe covers 24% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 2 people were impressed by this recipe. Not a lot of people really liked this main course. Head to the store and pick up sea salt, half greek yogurt and half mayo, sea salt, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the sea salt you could follow this main course with the Raspberry Sea Salt Brownies as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 71%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes are My Favorite Albacore Tuna Salad, Martha's Favorite Tuna Salad Sandwich, and Arielle's Favorite Tuna Casserole.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. You could try GEN5 Merlot. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: GEN5 Merlot

instructions: Right in the can, flake the tuna with a fork over a medium bowl, at the same time allowing the tuna to fall into the bowl. Squeeze the lemon over the tuna.Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl and mix well. Taste for seasoning.

steps.step: Right in the can, flake the tuna with a fork over a medium bowl, at the same time allowing the tuna to fall into the bowl. Squeeze the lemon over the tuna.
Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl and mix well. Taste for seasoning.
